question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: 1. I learned about existing privacy laws and the Supreme Court cases that led to those laws, 2. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Three things that I learned are: (1) how to articulate the importance of privacy, (2) the multitude of ways in which our privacy is being eroded, and (3) some resources to turn to to continue learning about privacy.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- multiple different ethical frameworks and how to apply them to evaluate specific technologies 
- the legal evolution of privacy law, why privacy matters, and different theoretical backgrounds of privacy law
- potential solutions to contemporary privacy infringements

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I definitely became more suspicious of the tech I use everyday. This class made me think a lot about our complicated relationship with technology and privacy.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. I learned about the various privacy practices tech companies fail to consider. 
2. I learned about the legal foundations underlying various privacy protections (and the lack thereof). 
3. I learned about the ethical frameworks used to educate our decision-making processes when it comes to the adoption of various technologies.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Professor Dellinger is very engaging and enthusiastic about the course material. She delivers it in a manner that makes you want to care about privacy, if you don't already.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The common/response prepared us for class discussion and helped me better engage with the material.  I also think the class was structured to promote conversation and friendly debate.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The topic of the course and the engaging lectures were very stimulating. Also the way professor Dellinger often turns questions to the experiences of the class forces us to think about the relevance of the discussed issues in our own lives.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The focus on privacy was what made this course so interesting. If this was just an ethics or just a tech class it would have been far less interesting. I also like how the topics of each week were all so relevant to problems facing us today.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text:
- content was organized well
- i liked how the assigned readings were mixed media, she would give us videos to watch, op-eds/digital articles, academic publications, and sometimes even art like poetry to consider, this made me want to do the readings and even excited about completing them
- the discussion post assignments and response assignments were effective at ensuring we were reflecting on our readings and prepared for class, also presented an opportunity to consider our peers' ideas

response_text: Such a fun, interesting class. Prof. Dellinger is so well versed in this field and shines light on some great topics.  She really promotes conversation and has an inviting teaching style. Class is great even if you have no background in technology.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
